channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As war in Gaza fractures Democrats, Republicans see an opening with Jewish voters
item.description: As Vice President Kamala Harris faces continued pressure from progressives over U.S. military aid to Israel, some Republicans see an opportunity to win over Jewish voters in key swing states.
item.content:encoded:
As Vice President Kamala Harris faces continued pressure from progressives over U.S. military aid to Israel, some Republicans see an opportunity to win over Jewish voters in key swing states.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: JP Morgan Chase is suing customers over 'infinite money glitch' ATM scam
item.description: JPMorgan Chase is filing lawsuits against customers who exploited a viral technical glitch this summer that allowed people to pull huge amounts from Chase ATMs.
item.content:encoded:
JPMorgan Chase is filing lawsuits against customers who exploited a viral technical glitch this summer that allowed people to pull huge amounts from Chase ATMs.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Man who attacked Nancy Pelosi's husband gets life in prison
item.description: David DePape, who was sentenced to 30 years in federal prison for attacking Paul Pelosi with a hammer, was sentenced to life without the possibility of parole following a separate state trial.
item.content:encoded:
David DePape, who was sentenced to 30 years in federal prison for attacking Paul Pelosi with a hammer, was sentenced to life without the possibility of parole following a separate state trial.

(Image credit: Michael Short)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: An Israeli airstrike in north Gaza killed dozens of people, as parliament bans UNRWA
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on a building in northern Gaza overnight killed at least 60 Palestinians, according to Gaza's Health Ministry.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli airstrike on a building in northern Gaza overnight killed at least 60 Palestinians, according to Gaza's Health Ministry.

(Image credit: -)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: U.S. citizens are among the voters removed in Virginia’s controversial purge
item.description: Nadra Wilson and other Virginians got letters saying her U.S. citizenship was in question, along with her voter registration. “I was born in Brooklyn, N.Y. — I'm a citizen,” Wilson told NPR.
item.content:encoded:
Nadra Wilson and other Virginians got letters saying her U.S. citizenship was in question, along with her voter registration. “I was born in Brooklyn, N.Y. — I'm a citizen,” Wilson told NPR.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Teri Garr, actor, comedian and multiple sclerosis ambassador, dies at 79
item.description: Garr's breakout role was as sexy Inga in Young Frankenstein. She earned an Oscar nomination for her role in the 1982 film Tootsie, and played Phoebe's mom on the sitcom Friends.
item.content:encoded:
Garr's breakout role was as sexy Inga in Young Frankenstein. She earned an Oscar nomination for her role in the 1982 film Tootsie, and played Phoebe's mom on the sitcom Friends.

(Image credit: Frederick M. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Tanya Ballard Brown

item.title: Undone by the loss of his brother Eddie, Alex Van Halen looks back in a new memoir
item.description: Though Alex had been the guitarist in the family, when they formed Van Halen, it quickly became clear who would play: "[Ed] made that instrument sing." Alex's new memoir is Brothers.
item.content:encoded: Though Alex had been the guitarist in the family, when they formed Van Halen, it quickly became clear who would play: "[Ed] made that instrument sing." Alex's new memoir is Brothers.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Steve Bannon feels 'empowered' after four months in federal prison
item.description: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon was back to hosting his daily podcast "War Room" just hours after his release from federal prison.
item.content:encoded:
Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon was back to hosting his daily podcast "War Room" just hours after his release from federal prison.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Facing fallout, Trump claims no president did more for Puerto Rico than he did
item.description: The Republican nominee's remarks come days after jokes about Puerto Ricans at his New York rally prompted backlash.
item.content:encoded:
The Republican nominee's remarks come days after jokes about Puerto Ricans at his New York rally prompted backlash.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Poop on Pelosi's desk, a neo-Nazi tiki torch: Mysterious statues are popping up in D.C.
item.description: Two politically pointed statues have mysteriously appeared in the nation’s capital in the leadup to the election: a pile of poop on the former House speaker's desk and a hand holding a tiki torch.
item.content:encoded:
Two politically pointed statues have mysteriously appeared in the nation’s capital in the leadup to the election: a pile of poop on the former House speaker's desk and a hand holding a tiki torch.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
